result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Cases 22CF76 & 22CF100 called @ 8:50 AM: Defendant Michael J. Groskreutz in court. Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Michael J. Groskreutz. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. As to case 22CF76: Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. As to case 22CF100: Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. As to both cases: The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed in both cases. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG plea entered as to all counts in both matters. STC scheduled - NOH given.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Cases 22CF76 & 22CF100 called @ 11:30 AM: Defendant Michael J. Groskreutz in court. Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Michael J. Groskreutz. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Dr. Jenna Gable sworn in for testimony. Direct examination by DA Leusink. Cross examination by Atty Rae. Dr. Gable excused at 11:41 AM. Atty Rae advises she believes the DE is currently not competent but likely to regain. The DE states he is currently not competent but likely to regain. DA Leusink requests that the Court find that the State has met its burden of proof to find that the DE is currently competent to proceed. Argument by DA Leusink. Statement by Atty Rae regarding treatment. Statement by the Court. The Court finds that the DE is competent to proceed. IA scheduled as to both matters - NOH given.
Initial appearance scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Initial appearance on October 7, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Cases 22CF76 & 22CF100 called @ 1:32 PM: Defendant Michael J. Groskreutz in court.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Michael J. Groskreutz.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. The parties have received the competency report. Statement by ADA Ryan regarding the report and its findings. ADA Ryan agrees with the findings of the report. Atty Rae requests testimony from the reporting Doctor. Competency Hearing scheduled - NOH given.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Competency hearing on September 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Competency hearing on September 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: 22CF76 & 22CF100 Case called @ 3:02 PM Defendant Michael J. Groskreutz in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by phone for Michael J. Groskreutz. The Court had previously ordered a 971.14 evaluation. Competency report filed by Dr. Benson. Atty Rae advises that her client is in agreement with the findings that the defendant is not competent but likely to regain competency within the time limits. DA Leusink agrees. The Court finds based on the doctor's report that the defendant is not competent but likely to regain competency within one year and orders the defendant to the complete the competency restoration program on an in-patient basis. The Court finds that the DE is not competent to refuse medication enters an involuntary medication and treatment order. The Court finds that there are 10 days CFTS on 22CF76 and 38 days CFTS on 22CF100.
Competency hearing on May 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Michael J. Groskreutz. Atty Rae advises the Court that she has reviewed the competency report with her client and is in agreement with the findings. The Court will schedule a competency hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter from Dr. Benson requesting extension of the date to return the competency evaluation
Letter from Dr. Benson requesting extension of the date to return the competency evaluation
Status conference on May 20, 2022 at 11:25 am.

No possession of combustibles or sources of ignition. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 11:41 AM Defendant Michael J. Groskreutz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer for Michael J. Groskreutz appeared by video, Attorney Wesley Kottke for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Eligibility for SPD services not yet determined. Atty Kottke raises issue of competency. Atty Patzer does not object. Court orders 971.14 Competency Eval on outpatient basis. Bond argument by ADA Kottke. Bond argument by Atty Patzer. Court orders $5,000 cash bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.
Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 11:10 am.
